summary: Defines the core VideoClip class and a collection of concrete subclasses that represent different kinds of video sources—static images, solid colors, generated bitmaps, text renderings, data‑driven frames, and simulation‑based frames. The module implements frame extraction, temporal handling, geometric and visual transformations, masking, audio attachment, and exporting to video, GIF, or image sequences using ffmpeg and imageio.
business_intent: Offer developers a high‑level, programmable interface for building, editing, and exporting video content in Python, enabling automated video generation, compositing, and post‑production workflows across media production, advertising, education, and entertainment applications.
